intro: Elaeodendron cunninghamii, commonly known as the broad-leafed elaeodendron, is a shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Elaeodendron cunninghamii is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
